text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

KAI CHAN: I think the
Blavatnik Fellowship gives you

the opportunity to learn about
entrepreneurship while acting

in a real world scenario
to start that company.

ANANYA ZUTSHI: So
many things have

to come together for
a company to be born
and real and out in the world.

The Blavatnik Fellowship
was the start for me,
really the catalyst.

SHARDULE SHAH: The
fellowship program

is the best way for
me to be able to take

the company not only from 0
to 1 but really from 1 to 100.

LAURA KELLEY: I think
what differentiates

the fellowship from some
of the other incubators

is that it focuses on you
as well as your company.

GREG EKCHIAN: I feel
really lucky to be

able to say I was a
Blavatnik Fellow at HBS.

I think that really makes
a difference when you're

talking to investors and
partners and other folks

that you want to grow
your company with.

I think they now know
OK, this is someone

who's technically sound, but
also very sound on the business
front.

DAN AHLSTEDT: I think the
fellowship was an excellent way

to really de-risk
becoming an entrepreneur.

To have people to
have capital, to have

different resources available
to you over 12 months

and give you that room to
really focus and really

do deep dives on your
technology and on your business.

SOPHIE BAI: I think
scientists are most

suited to become
entrepreneurs because we

fail every single day,
multiple times a day.
Experiments never work.

The fellowship provided
so much to make it

a rather risk-free environment
for us to fail fearlessly.

ALEX YOUSSEF: Being
a part of a community

of experienced entrepreneurs
who have created or are running

large companies is
incredibly valuable

because you can tap and
access that expertise.

ANANYA ZUTSHI: When you're
starting off in your career,

when you're a first
time entrepreneur,

you're really borrowing
the credibility
of the people around you.

And the credibility behind
me is an immense amount

of talented, brilliant
individual successful companies
that I get to borrow from.

Being able to do that really
sets me up for success in a way

that I don't know would have
been possible without it.

KAI CHAN: This
fellowship has really

given us the time and runway
to de-risk this target,

attack the target and try to
develop meaningful medicines.

DAN AHLSTEDT: What started
as a really good piece

of technology, a
year later, now it

looks like a really
great company

to invest in that has
a promising future.

ALEX YOUSSEF: So we're
building this engine that

would allow us to
create therapeutic video

games for a variety of
developmental, cognitive and
mental disorders.

LAURA KELLEY: The
novel technology

I commercialized during
the Blavatnik allowed

us to do this, and the
resources to determine

how we approach pharma for
our initial partnerships.

SHARDULE SHAH: I'm
looking forward

to using the learnings
from their program

to build Lime Therapeutics into
the world's leading company.

There is no greater
program out there

that will allow you to
do what you aspire to do.

ANANYA ZUTSHI: I know that this
fellowship and the community

that it's built and that
I get to be a part of
doesn't end in a few weeks.

They're going to be
the people that I

turn to for a very long time
when I need advice or want
to just talk about something.
This community is for life.
